## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT3G20630](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT3G20630)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>ATUBP14, DA3, PER1, TARANI, TNI, TTN6, UBP14</u>
- **Gene Name:** phosphate deficiency root hair defective1, TARANI, TITAN6, ubiquitin-specific protease 14
- **Description:**   ubiquitin-specific protease 14;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** 
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Transcripts:
   -  [AT3G20630.1](https://www.arabidopsis.org/gene?name=AT3G20630.1)
## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [CS16078]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;embryo defective; enlarged endosperm nuclei, immature seeds are filled with a watery endosperm and have a glassy appearance.
   - [CS16079]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;embryo defective; enlarged endosperm nuclei, immature seeds are filled with a watery endosperm and have a glassy appearance.
   - [CS860099]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Embryo defective, lethal.
   - [CS860100]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Embryo defective, lethal.
   - [da3-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Large cotyledons and flowers, showed higher ploidy levels than wt.
   - [da3-1 sud6-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;sud6-1 partially suppresses the large cotyle- don and growth retardation phenotypes of da3-1(single mutant produces large cotyledons and flowers with increased cell size and endoreduplication.)
   - [elh]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Elongated hypocotyl when grown at 28C. Increased cell size in leaves and other tissues due to cell elongation vs increase in cell number.
   - [per1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;per1 plants show normal root hair development under control conditions but displayed an inhibited root hair elongation phenotype upon Pi deficiency. The per1 mutant exhibits a pleiotropic phenotype under control conditions, resembling Pi-deficient plants in several aspects.
   - [tni-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Decreased auxin responsiveness. Polymorphic phenotype with many developmental defects including tricotyledon,increased floral organ number, reduced lateral roots, abnormal leaf venation. Also resembles some auxin transport mutants.
   - [tni-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Leaves are larger, rounder and curve upward compared to wild type. Leaf lamina are cup shaped. Increased branding of trichomes.
